meaningMnemonic: Being in the <kanji>versus</kanji> <kanji>yonder</kanji> (the opposite side) means you are in one yonder and someone is in the other yonder, and you are coming towards each other. So this means <vocabulary>to be oncoming</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to come towards</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word that uses the on'yomi readings of the kanji. You should be able to read this on your own.
